description.narrative: The project would contribute to a (i) strengthened capacity of the CCO to carry out its mandate in key public sector management areas for improved coordination, monitoring and evaluation; and to (ii) the increased use of modern e-government, procurement, human resource management and social accountability tools as well as improved capacity for investment promotion.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I (a) | Description :Establish, operate and maintain, at all times during Projectimplementation and within the State Modernization Directorate, the PIUwith a structure, functions and responsibilities set in OM. |Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I (d) | Description :Create, and maintain throughout each calendar year of Projectimplementation, a specific budget line entry in the relevant annual budget to keep track of expenditures incurred during imp. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section II.A.1 | Description :Prepare Project Reports in accordance with Section 5.08 of GralConditions and on the basis of Proj. indicators set in OM. Each Proj. Report shall cover the period of one calendar semester. |Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Percentage of federal agencies customized and connected to electronic platform (INFO.AR).

target.value: 100 percent of the federal administration

actual.value: 90 percent of the federal administration (APN) is connected through the portal Argentina Comparte.

comment.narrative: Almost achieved. The portal currently has 90 public policies uploaded, as well as a Rapid guide on Public Policies with more than120.

title.narrative: SECOP used by all national administration

target.value: 100 percent

comment.narrative: This indicator is expected to be met with the development of new modules in AR.COMPRA and national legislation, which will allowfor increased purchases through electronic means.

title.narrative: Number of FOI requests submitted by electronic means (INFO.AR) [out of the total number of requests per year]

baseline.value: Baseline: 0 (INFO.AR will be developed throughout the project)

target.value: 70 percent

actual.value: Achieved. The Decree stipulates that requests for public information be made manually, and presented before the liason office ofeach organization.

comment.narrative: Received requests are processed by the SRIyFD of the JGM. Work was initiated on Active Transparency following assistance in theonline publication of public information for citizen awareness via different websites (ArgentinaComparte, Internet Sano,Argentina.gob.ar, etc.)

title.narrative: CCO functional and organizational assessment done, agreed upon, and consensus for its partial implementation generated

baseline.value: Comprehensive CCO functional and organizational assessment was never done before.

target.value: Operational guidelines harmonized and synchronized among functional areas of CCO

actual.value: Achieved. The tasks associated with the integrated functional assessment were finalized and the indicator was deemed to have beencompleted based on the current context in the 2010 mid-term review.

title.narrative: The e-Government Services Platform provides services such as interoperability, data and security standards and digital certificatesand signature

target.value: 6 G2C services implemented and operational10 new agencies are implementing the plans with activities such as digitalcertificatesand digital signatures

actual.value: The platform is ready and functioning. 57 agencies with digital signatures.

comment.narrative: G2C implementation to be undertaken during the extension period. The target is expected to be met with the implementation of theEDAP. The process to contract the service is in process, and signing of the contract is expected in August 2014.

title.narrative: A plan and model for citizen-centric single-window portal and the portal for proceedings finalized, visits to portals and % increase in satisfaction rates of users, as measured by satisfaction survey

baseline.value: Existing national portal and proceedings portal

target.value: Pilots are expanded and assessed to design the final plan 1,00,000 visits per year, 5% percent increase in their satisfaction rates

actual.value: Achieved. In 2014, through May, the portal had received 1,195,403 visits and 2,415,960 pages were viewed. Satisfaction ratesthrough the portal are 61.47%.

comment.narrative: The portal receives 57,757 visits each week. Currently, there are 1,095 processes published and 1,165 inputted in the System.

title.narrative: CCO functional and organizational assessment done, agreed and consensus for its partial implementation generated

target.value: Operational guidelines are standardized and formulated with a synchronized institutional vision among functional areas ofCCO(thiswas the indicator for YR3, no indicator for YR 4)

actual.value: Achieved. The tasks associated with the integrated functional assessment were finalized and the indicator was deemed to have beencompleted based on the current context in the 2010 mid-term review.

title.narrative: Civilian central government posts with full job description & career path [increase in thousands]

baseline.value: Posts satisfying these criteria as of July 30, 2007

comment.narrative: Profiles for 3152 unfrozen positions within decentralized jurisdictions and entities were analyzed.

title.narrative: Development, implementation and impact of the assets management module

target.value: Efficiency gains measured as a percentage of institutional budget savings or surplus achieved by virtue of the application ofAssets Module management of public assets, Percentage of target efficiency savings to be established by Working Group.

actual.value: Achieved. All of the lessons learned are applied by the subcomponent under the JGM. Inventory of public sector physical assetsinstitutions completed. Other principle actions include: technical assistance for the renovation of the Public Management buildingand elaboration of a manual of good practices in physical asset management.

comment.narrative: So far in 2014, use of space in JGM's buildings has been surveyed, detailed data on property has been collected, visits carriedoutto JGM spaces to identify spaces for moving, technical assistance to the JGM, among others. The websitehttp://www.bienesdelestado.gob.ar/ has all of the complete information on the national public administration's assets.

title.narrative: Communication strategies defined; communication plans adopted; and communication tools, mechanisms used regularly

target.value: Communicational plans adopted (16 months) and used regularly (22 months)

comment.narrative: This indicator was taken as achieved in the 2010 mid term review, with communication mechanisms used regularly. Communicationstrategy based on successful experience from prior years.

title.narrative: Design and implementation of the IT system

target.value: New IT system operational

comment.narrative: 5 systems developed and operational (Undersecretariat of Evaluation of Projects with External Financing, ONEP, Monitoring of CCPat ONIG, National Quality Award, and the BEC.AR program ).Two more dashboards are under development.

title.narrative: Stakeholder analysis to assess support to project activities

target.value: Report on implementation of lessons learned

comment.narrative: A report with the results and lessons learned from 6 case studies was prepared. In general, the tools were viewed positively.

title.narrative: Institutional performance indicators of the agencies that represent 50% of public expenditure in the National Public Administration, incorporated into the M&E system and monitored

comment.narrative: Achieved. 22 entities of the national public administration carry out monitoring with the SIG Metas dashboard.

title.narrative: Percent increase of users understanding quality standards, goal, and indicators adopted by CCP agencies measured through annual surveys

comment.narrative: Achieved. As reported in the last ISR, the results of the annual survey showed that 9 of 12 organizations improved theirevaluation, 2 stayed the same, and one fell in relation to the baseline. No additional studies have been carried out since thelast ISR.

title.narrative: Ministries with strategic planning processes that enable the application of a system of results-based management

comment.narrative: Achieved. Agencies are SNR, INCAA, Parques Nacionales (National Directorate for Protection of Protected Areas), Colonia Montes deOca (Ministry of Health) Prov. Tierra del Fuego, and BNM.

title.narrative: Increase in the base of suppliers and number of supplier participating in procurement processes

comment.narrative: Achieved. Since the last report, 2232 more providers entered, of which 468 participated in contract processes.

title.narrative: Percentage of civilian central government personnel incorporated in SINFO ensuring that information is updated automatically; personnel data that appear in both SINFO and LUPI systems are consistent

comment.narrative: Almost achieved. The BUPE application allows visualizing information of public employees. BUPE is being implemented within theJefatura de Gabinete de Ministros (SARHA). Currently, the development of new tools to make BUPE a key information source (throughmore effective and functional registry of information) is planned.

title.narrative: Percentage of technical and professional staff in ONEP and the personnel offices in ministries and agencies trained in new technologies and employment regimes

comment.narrative: Continuing to provide technical assistance to the staffing directorates as needed. Planning was carried out for a virtualworkshopplanned for the third quarter of 2014 for those responsible for training management.

title.narrative: The jurisdictional module of the SIG and the module to follow up the Congress Agenda are installed and operational.

target.value: Includes all programs of six ministries or agencies.

actual.value: Achieved. SIG Metas is now installed in 19 jurisdictions and functioning in a continuous and systematic manner, applied at thecentral level of the jurisdiction.

comment.narrative: Currently, 22 entities of the national public administration carrying out monitoring with the SIG Metas dashboard.

title.narrative: Guidelines for ISO 9001 certification designed and disseminated among agencies

comment.narrative: Currently, there are 35 entities participating in the Carta Compromiso con el Ciudadano Program.

title.narrative: The current single-window portal is enhanced and provides integrated and, some, transactional services

target.value: 6 transactional service, based on at least 2 agencies integration

actual.value: Continuing advances in identification and analysis of processes.

comment.narrative: Expected to be met with the implementation of the EDAP.The platform allows for interoperability of services and communicationwith citizens through the web portals like ArgentinaComparte, Argentina.gob.ar, and Guia de Tramites (www.tramites.gob.ar). fromwhich one can access a summary of all current public policies.

title.narrative: Quality management of INAP training, certified by ISO norms

target.value: Accreditation by INAP of third parties training programs based on quality standards of ISO norms

comment.narrative: INAP has been certified by ISO norms. In May 2014, it initiated work to re-certify its training processes. Between August 2013and May 2014, technical assistance was developed in the Internal Auditing Unit of JGM. In March 2014, the elaboration of variousdocuments (including quality policy, specific procedures for planning processes, corrective actions, among others) was completedand are now being revised for approval and entry into effect.

title.narrative: Satisfaction rate on services provided by agencies subscribing the Citizens# Charter Program (as measured by annual percents increases in selected agencies satisfaction indexes)

comment.narrative: Partially achieved. There are currently 40 entities incorporated within the Citizens Charter Program. No additional studies areplanned in relation to this indicator.

title.narrative: Ad hoc reports are prepared by SISEG for each budget reallocation of JGM when they affect the budget appropriations of the agenciesthat are being monitored

target.value: Reports are prepared by SISEG for each budget reallocation of JGM when they affect the budget appropriations of the agencies thatare being monitored

comment.narrative: Performance reports are regularly prepared for the Cabinet and Administrative Coordination Secretary for consideration.

title.narrative: The E-government Unified Services Platform implemented and in operation

target.value: Platform in operation

comment.narrative: Platform is installed and coperational (Subsecretariat of Management Technologies, SSTG).

title.narrative: Civilian central government posts with full job description & career path [increase in thousands]

comment.narrative: Profiles for 3152 unfrozen positions within decentralized jurisdictions and entities were analyzed.

title.narrative: Quick-gains programs studies done and implementation strategy developed

comment.narrative: Providers did not comply with the TOR and the study was not contracted. The new authorities prioritized other activities. Instead,a Program for Planning Contracts and Public Purchases was carried out. Within this Program, Decree No. 1188/2012 has allowed for15% savings in the purchased value of national public administration's vehicles.

title.narrative: Percentage of federal government staff trained through the PROCAE.

target.value: 30 percent (60.000 employees)

comment.narrative: Recent activities include the development and implementation of virtual training for support staff in the national publicadministration, and for the diffusion of various public policies, among others.

title.narrative: Elaboration of a diagnosis of RBM programs executed during the first SMP, development of the conceptual model and methodological framework of an integrated results-based management system for the APN

target.value: Report on lessons learned from pilot.

comment.narrative: Successfully concluded between 2011 and 2012. A document was elaborated and a workshop was carried out. Implementation ofresultsbased management is being progressively developed, with implementation by PRODEV.

title.narrative: New modalities introduced in national system by agency

target.value: 10 percent of procurement units in federal administration

actual.value: 5 percent of national purchases use the new modalities.

comment.narrative: Target expected to be met with the development of new modalities for AR.COMPRA, which will allow for advances in the electronicprocurement system. These developments should be accompanied by national regulations.
Target met for year 2013. Quarterly progress is being monitored in 2014.

title.narrative: A security data center for small agencies is implemented and 15 agencies are now using the center as the main data center for critical systems.

target.value: Center is fully operational and it is evaluated

actual.value: Achieved. The new data center for government is fully operational.

comment.narrative: The center provides the following services: email, archiving, connectivity, active directory, hosting of sites and applications,and name resolution. It provides services to 74 organizations with are within Jefatura de Gabinete's sphere.

title.narrative: The SISEG report is taken into account during the budget process of the agencies monitored

target.value: the proposed budget of at least four agencies cite as one of their sources the SISEG report

actual.value: Achieved. SISEG reports are used by the Ministry of Labor, the Nuclear Regulatory Agency, and the Subsecretariat for EvaluationofProjects with External Financing. In 2013, the Secretariat of the Cabinet and Administrative Coordination was added.

comment.narrative: The entities which have been using the SISEG since 2014 uploaded their targets in April, and as such they have not yet been usedinthe budget project.

title.narrative: SECOP used by all national administration

comment.narrative: The national public administration uses AR.COMPRA. Advances are expected to be made with the development of new modules inAR.COMPRA and national legislation, which will allow for increased purchases through electronic means.

title.narrative: A plan and model for a citizen-centric single-window portal and the portal for proceedings are finalized, visits to the portals andpercent increase in satisfaction rates of users

target.value: Pilots are expanded and assessed to design the final plan1,00,000 visits per year 5 percent increase in their satisfaction rates

actual.value: Achieved. In 2014, through May, the portal had received 1,195,403 visits and 2,415,960 pages were viewed. Satisfaction ratesthrough the portal are 61.47%.

comment.narrative: The portal receives 57,757 visits each week. Currently, there are 1,095 processes published and 1,165 inputted in the System.

title.narrative: Number of domestic businesses reached by the innovation strategy

target.value: 20 businesses

comment.narrative: This indicator was noted to have been achieved in the mid-term review undertaken in 2010. At that point, the strategy forstrengthening local businesses' capacities, reflected in Programa Pioneros, already included 20 businesses.

title.narrative: The IPA has developed and implemented a methodology for a systematic and comparable assessment of sectors and clusters.

target.value: 7 (cumulative) sector/cluster assessment undertaken

comment.narrative: This indicator was noted to have been achieved in the mid-term review undertaken in 2010. Development of the methodology had beencarried out, and applied to 7 priority sectors/clusters (agroindustry in sheep, goat and pork meat, berries and berry products, anddairy products; auto part manufacturing; agricultural machinery manufacturing; manufacturing of machinery for general use; chemicaland petrochemical manufacturing; tradeable IT and software services; and tradeable outsourcing of professional services).

title.narrative: Participation mechanisms have been established and used regularly

target.value: Used regularly

comment.narrative: Workshops and seminars aimed at discussing and validating the actions undertaken were carried out. Two final activities areplanned - one related to the dashboard of ministerial goals and another presenting the Project's achievements and lessons learned.

title.narrative: Agreement among CCO, MECON, and the authorities managing the main public programs to establish guidelines for the use and implementation of systems for RBM and M&E, including generation of information

target.value: Report on lessons learned from pilot.

actual.value: Acheived. Pilot in ARN finalized and report on lessons learned produced.

title.narrative: Reduction of number of days in responding to access to information

actual.value: Achieved. The Decree 1172/2003 provides 10 days to respond to information requests.
